name: places/ChIJCcZo2g_2wokRBjPcT4CdUWo
formattedAddress: Storefront, 15 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: Storefront, 15 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text:
It was not my first experience of painting class but the first with this enterprise. What is good they have plenty of choice of pictures to paint (I believe they paint several pictures a day), the room is quiet big, you can book private events, they are open till late night and have many locations around the city.

What I didnâ€™t like is the constant noise/laugh of drunk people around (wine is OK to be brought and consumed during the class) which quiet annoying and cause some headache and which our teacher did not even try to manage. My husband and I donâ€™t drink at all. Also teacher did not manage to finish the picture in two hours, maybe 2 and half and we started 15 min later.

We booked the class for 8:30 pm and left the room at 12:30 am as you have to wait till the painting dries (in previous place they provide hair dryer to speed up the process), finally were at home at 2 am, take it into consideration.

originalText.text: Book the Painting Lounge for my bday. When I say the best time ever!!!! Our instructor Carmine was amazing, and patience. If you're thinking about it, just do itðŸ˜‰

text.text: Book the Painting Lounge for my bday. When I say the best time ever!!!! Our instructor Carmine was amazing, and patience. If you're thinking about it, just do itðŸ˜‰

originalText.text: Excellent place with equally excellent instructors that are willing to help and are super nice and knowledgeable. John John was our instructor and he did an excellent job taking us through how to paint everything. The class is about 2 hours long and you get a lovely painting at the end of it. Highly recommend, especially since it's only $30.

text.text: Excellent place with equally excellent instructors that are willing to help and are super nice and knowledgeable. John John was our instructor and he did an excellent job taking us through how to paint everything. The class is about 2 hours long and you get a lovely painting at the end of it. Highly recommend, especially since it's only $30.

originalText.text: I had the best time ever. Chris the instructor has a great personality and loved his teaching style. I also loved how the assistants constantly walked around the room scanning to see who needs help. I wish this paint lounge was in Baltimore. Will definitely come back on another visit to NYC

text.text: I had the best time ever. Chris the instructor has a great personality and loved his teaching style. I also loved how the assistants constantly walked around the room scanning to see who needs help. I wish this paint lounge was in Baltimore. Will definitely come back on another visit to NYC

originalText.text:
The service is good, however my expectations were not met. Compare the picture that was on the studio website and the photo in the studio. There are two paintings on the wall. The left one was the example, and the right one was drawn by the host during the class. I really wanted to see and try, but in fact the drawing was much more primitive. Or did I not understand something and there are classes of different levels?
* - after uploading the image, I noticed that the image from the website was heavily corrected on the computer. That's where the details come from.
